column4: I'm looking for some advice. I'm planning to use a spare disk I having lying around exclusively for my incoming torrent files (using torrentflux to feed a house full of nerds). What filesystem should I use on this disk? given the type of filesystem traffic BT generates, it can fragment even XFS partitions into an unholy mess. Is XFS still the best bet?
do you use a ups? then xfs. it will be faster for multiple users ("multitasking").
no UPS, but power is pretty stable where I am.
ok then, go with xfs if you feel it
